title: Frank Lampard turned down offers for Kurt Zouma as he describes his form as 'fantastic'
text:
Frank Lampard admitted he turned down interest in the summer for centre back Kurt Zouma, in the knowledge that he would play an important first-team role at Chelsea this season.

Zouma, who was on loan at Everton last season, has forged a partnership with Fikayo Tomori and the pair have flourished together during the Blues' seven-match win streak in all competitions.

Chelsea are looking to make it eight from eight this evening against Manchester United in the Carabao Cup, and manager Lampard praised Zouma's form following a shaky opening-weekend performance against the Red Devils in August.

Kurt Zouma has nailed down a spot in the starting XI under Frank Lampard at Chelsea this year

Lampard was keen to keep hold of Zouma in the summer with Everton interested throughout

Goals: 1

Red cards: 0 Statistics according to Transfermarkt

'He has been fantastic – there was a belief that I had in Kurt because there was interest in the summer after we all know he had a very good loan at Everton last year,' said Lampard.

'But I believed in him as I believed in Tomori – that is why I made the decisions I made pre-season in terms of where we were going to look defensively.'

After impressing during his time at Goodison Park last season, Everton were very keen to sign the French international permanently, yet Lampard held firm knowing that he couldn't replace him, as Chelsea were banned from signing players in the summer.

Zouma could start his sixth game on the trot if he plays on Wednesday at Stamford Bridge, and Lampard acknowledged that the 25-year-old has taken his opportunity following Andreas Christensen's injury, as well as the long-term absence of Antonio Rudiger.

'It has been nice to get some stability, albeit because of injuries, between him and Fikayo in the last games,' Lampard stated.

Fikayo Tomori and Zouma have forged a partnership in defence for Chelsea in recent weeks

'It has been good to get them playing together, to see the little bond they are getting on and off the pitch.

'It is a nice little story and it must continue, I suppose.'

Lampard comes up against Man United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer for the second time this season, following United's 4-0 opening-weekend victory at Old Trafford on August 11.
